margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">n</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> are the independent variables,</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1165" data-end="1198" class="">
<p data-start="1167" data-end="1198" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>β</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\beta_0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0528em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> is the intercept,</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1201" data-end="1292" class="">
<p data-start="1203" data-end="1292" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>β</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo separator="true">,</mo><msub><mi>β</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo separator="true">,</mo><mo>…</mo><mo separator="true">,</mo><msub><mi>β</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\beta_1, \beta_2, \dots, \beta_n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0528em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; </li>
<li data-start="1295" data-end="1330" class="">
<p data-start="1297" data-end="1330" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>ϵ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\epsilon</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">ϵ</span></span></span></span> is the error term.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="1332" data-end="1373" class="">2. <strong data-start="1339" data-end="1373">Objective of Linear Regression</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1374" data-end="1643" class="">The goal is to find the line (or hyperplane in the case of multiple variables) that best fits the data. This is done by estimating the coefficients (<span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>β</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo separator="true">,</mo><msub><mi>β</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo separator="true">,</mo><mo>…</mo><mo separator="true">,</mo><msub><mi>β</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\beta_0, \beta_1, \dots, \beta_n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0528em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0528em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="minner">…</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.1514em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0528em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">n</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>) that minimize the difference between the actual and predicted values of <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">y</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.625em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span></span></span></span>.</p>
<h3 data-start="1645" data-end="1688" class="">3. <strong data-start="1652" data-end="1688">Assumptions in Linear Regression</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1689" data-end="1737" class="">Linear regression makes several key assumptions:</p>
<ol data-start="1738" data-end="2246">
<li data-start="1738" data-end="1831" class="">
<p data-start="1741" data-end="1831" class=""><strong data-start="1741" data-end="1754">Linearity</strong>: The relationship between the dependent and independent variables is linear.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1832" data-end="1911" class="">
<p data-start="1835" data-end="1911" class=""><strong data-start="1835" data-end="1861">Independence of errors</strong>: The residuals (errors) should not be correlated.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1912" data-end="2033" class="">
<p data-start="1915" data-end="2033" class=""><strong data-start="1915" data-end="1935">Homoscedasticity</strong>: The variance of the residuals should be constant across all levels of the independent variables.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2034" data-end="2132" class="">
<p data-start="2037" data-end="2132" class=""><strong data-start="2037" data-end="2050">Normality</strong>: The residuals should be normally distributed (important for hypothesis testing).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2133" data-end="2246" class="">
<p data-start="2136" data-end="2246" class=""><strong data-start="2136" data-end="2170">No or little multicollinearity</strong>: The independent variables should not be highly correlated with each other.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<h3 data-start="2248" data-end="2286" class="">4. <strong data-start="2255" data-end="2286">How Linear Regression Works</strong></h3>
<p data-start="2287" data-end="2553" class="">To estimate the coefficients <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\beta</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span></span></span></span>, linear regression uses a method called <strong data-start="2368" data-end="2400">Ordinary Least Squares (OLS)</strong>. This method minimizes the sum of squared residuals (errors), which is the difference between the actual and predicted values of the dependent variable.</p>
<p data-start="2555" data-end="2607" class="">The residuals for each data point are calculated as:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>ϵ</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><mover accent="true"><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\epsilon_i = y_i - \hat{y_i}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5806em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">ϵ</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0359em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord accent"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.6944em;"><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0359em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="accent-body" style="left: -0.25em;"><span class="mord">^</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.1944em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>
<p data-start="2643" data-end="2649" class="">Where:</p>
<ul data-start="2650" data-end="2745">
<li data-start="2650" data-end="2684" class="">
<p data-start="2652" data-end="2684" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">y_i</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.625em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0359em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> is the observed value,</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2685" data-end="2745" class="">
<p data-start="2687" data-end="2745" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mover accent="true"><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\hat{y_i}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord accent"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.6944em;"><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0359em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="accent-body" style="left: -0.25em;"><span class="mord">^</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.1944em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> is the predicted value based on the model.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="2747" data-end="2792" class="">5. <strong data-start="2754" data-end="2792">Cost Function (Mean Squared Error)</strong></h3>
<p data-start="2793" data-end="2935" class="">Linear regression uses a cost function to evaluate the model's performance. The most common cost function is the <strong data-start="2906" data-end="2934">Mean Squared Error (MSE)</strong>:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>n</mi></mfrac><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>n</mi></munderover><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><mover accent="true"><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>^</mo></mover><msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">MSE = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^{n} (y_i - \hat{y_i})^2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05764em;">MSE</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.9291em; vertical-align: -1.2777em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3214em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mop op-limits"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.6514em;"><span style="top: -1.8723em; margin-left: 0em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span><span class="mrel mtight">=</span><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span><span class="mop op-symbol large-op">∑</span></span></span><span style="top: -4.3em; <p data-start="2995" data-end="3001" class="">Where:</p>
<ul data-start="3002" data-end="3116">
<li data-start="3002" data-end="3041" class="">
<p data-start="3004" data-end="3041" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span> is the number of data points,</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3042" data-end="3074" class="">
<p data-start="3044" data-end="3074" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">y_i</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.625em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0359em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> is the actual value,</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3075" data-end="3116" class="">
<p data-start="3077" data-end="3116" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mover accent="true"><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\hat{y_i}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord accent"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.6944em;"><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0359em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="accent-body" style="left: -0.25em;"><span class="mord">^</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.1944em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> is the predicted value.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="3118" data-end="3249" class="">The goal is to minimize this cost function during the training phase by adjusting the coefficients (<span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>β</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo separator="true">,</mo><msub><mi>β</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo separator="true">,</mo><mo>…</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\beta_0, \beta_1, \dots</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0528em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0528em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="minner">…</span></span></span></span>).</p>
<h3 data-start="3251" data-end="3280" class="">6. <strong data-start="3258" data-end="3280">Evaluation Metrics</strong></h3>
<p data-start="3281" data-end="3358" class="">Once the model is trained, we evaluate its performance using several metrics:</p>
<ul data-start="3359" data-end="4177">
<li data-start="3359" data-end="3719" class="">
<p data-start="3361" data-end="3558" class=""><strong data-start="3361" data-end="3386">R-squared (<span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">R^2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8141em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.00773em;">R</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8141em;"><span style="top: -3.063em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>)</strong>: Measures the proportion of the variance in the dependent variable that is explained by the independent variables. It ranges from 0 to 1, where 1 means perfect prediction.</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>n</mi></munderover><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><mover accent="true"><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>^</mo></mover><msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>n</mi></munderover><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>y</mi><mo>ˉ</mo></mover><msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">R^2 = 1 - \frac{\sum_{i=1}^n (y_i - \hat{y_i})^2}{\sum_{i=1}^n (y_i - \bar{y})^2}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8641em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.00773em;">R</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8641em;"><span style="top: -3.113em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.994em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span>
<p data-start="3655" data-end="3719" class="">Where <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>y</mi><mo>ˉ</mo></mover></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\bar{y}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7622em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord accent"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.5678em;"><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span></span><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="accent-body" style="left: -0.1944em;"><span class="mord">ˉ</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.1944em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> is the mean of the actual values of <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">y</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.625em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3721" data-end="3830" class="">
<p data-start="3723" data-end="3830" class=""><strong data-start="3723" data-end="3745">Adjusted R-squared</strong>: Adjusts <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">R^2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8141em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.00773em;">R</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8141em;"><span style="top: -3.063em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> for the number of predictors in the model to prevent overfitting.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3834" data-end="3974" class="">
<p data-start="3836" data-end="3911" class=""><strong data-start="3836" data-end="3865">Mean Absolute Error (MAE)</strong>: Measures the average of the absolute errors.</p>

<h3 data-start="4179" data-end="4221" class="">7. <strong data-start="4186" data-end="4221">Advantages of Linear Regression</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="4222" data-end="4540">
<li data-start="4222" data-end="4273" class="">
<p data-start="4224" data-end="4273" class=""><strong data-start="4224" data-end="4238">Simplicity</strong>: Easy to understand and interpret.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4274" data-end="4337" class="">
<p data-start="4276" data-end="4337" class=""><strong data-start="4276" data-end="4290">Efficiency</strong>: Computationally efficient for large datasets.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4338" data-end="4430" class="">
<p data-start="4340" data-end="4430" class=""><strong data-start="4340" data-end="4353">Linearity</strong>: Works well when the relationship between variables is approximately linear.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4431" data-end="4540" class="">
<p data-start="4433" data-end="4540" class=""><strong data-start="4433" data-end="4464">Foundation for Other Models</strong>: Basis for more advanced models like Ridge, Lasso, and logistic regression.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="4542" data-end="4585" class="">8. <strong data-start="4549" data-end="4585">Limitations of Linear Regression</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="4586" data-end="5047">
<li data-start="4586" data-end="4691" class="">
<p data-start="4588" data-end="4691" class=""><strong data-start="4588" data-end="4612">Linearity Assumption</strong>: It only works well if the relationship between the variables is truly linear.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4692" data-end="4806" class="">
<p data-start="4694" data-end="4806" class=""><strong data-start="4694" data-end="4706">Outliers</strong>: Linear regression is sensitive to outliers, which can have a disproportionate effect on the model.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4807" data-end="4938" class="">
<p data-start="4809" data-end="4938" class=""><strong data-start="4809" data-end="4830">Multicollinearity</strong>: If the independent variables are highly correlated, it can lead to unstable estimates of the coefficients.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4939" data-end="5047" class="">
<p data-start="4941" data-end="5047" class=""><strong data-start="4941" data-end="4959">No interaction</strong>: Linear regression assumes no interaction between predictors unless explicitly modeled.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="5049" data-end="5091" class="">9. <strong data-start="5056" data-end="5091">Extensions of Linear Regression</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="5092" data-end="5594">
<li data-start="5092" data-end="5240" class="">
<p data-start="5094" data-end="5240" class=""><strong data-start="5094" data-end="5114">Ridge Regression</strong>: A variation of linear regression that includes a regularization term to prevent overfitting when there is multicollinearity.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5241" data-end="5372" class="">
<p data-start="5243" data-end="5372" class=""><strong data-start="5243" data-end="5263">Lasso Regression</strong>: Similar to Ridge but with a penalty term that can lead to sparse solutions (some coefficients become zero).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5373" data-end="5441" class="">
<p data-start="5375" data-end="5441" class=""><strong data-start="5375" data-end="5390">Elastic Net</strong>: A combination of both Ridge and Lasso regression.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5442" data-end="5594" class="">
<p data-start="5444" data-end="5594" class=""><strong data-start="5444" data-end="5469">Polynomial Regression</strong>: When the relationship between variables is not linear, polynomial regression can be used to model non-linear relationships.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="5596" data-end="5641" class="">10. <strong data-start="5604" data-end="5641">Applications of Linear Regression</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="5642" data-end="6018">
<li data-start="5642" data-end="5754" class="">
<p data-start="5644" data-end="5754" class=""><strong data-start="5644" data-end="5665">Predicting prices</strong>: For example, predicting house prices based on features like size, number of rooms, etc.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5755" data-end="5847" class="">
<p data-start="5757" data-end="5847" class=""><strong data-start="5757" data-end="5776">Risk assessment</strong>: Used in finance to model stock prices, market trends, or credit risk.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5848" data-end="5928" class="">
<p data-start="5850" data-end="5928" class=""><strong data-start="5850" data-end="5863">Marketing</strong>: Analyzing the relationship between advertising spend and sales.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5929" data-end="6018" class="">
<p data-start="5931" data-end="6018" class=""><strong data-start="5931" data-end="5941">Health</strong>: Predicting disease progression or treatment outcomes based on patient data.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="6020" data-end="6034" class="">Conclusion</h3>
<p data-start="6035" data-end="6306" class="">Linear regression is a fundamental technique in both statistics and machine learning, providing a simple yet powerful method for modeling relationships between variables. It’s important to check assumptions and validate the model to ensure its accuracy and effectiveness.</p></div></div></div></div><div class="mb-2 flex gap-3 -ml-2" tabindex="0"><div class="flex dark:prose-invert dark"><h3 data-start="0" data-end="55" class=""><strong data-start="4" data-end="53">Gradient Descent: A Comprehensive Explanation</strong></h3>
<p data-start="57" data-end="342" class="">Gradient Descent is an optimization algorithm used to minimize a function by iteratively moving in the direction of the steepest descent. It is widely used in machine learning, particularly for training models like <strong data-start="272" data-end="331">linear regression, logistic regression, neural networks</strong>, and more.</p>
<hr data-start="344" data-end="347" class="">
<h2 data-start="349" data-end="384" class=""><strong data-start="352" data-end="384">1. What is Gradient Descent?</strong></h2>
<p data-start="385" data-end="654" class="">Gradient Descent is an iterative optimization algorithm used to find the minimum of a function. Given a function <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">f(\theta)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.10764em;">f</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span>, gradient descent updates the parameters <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span> in the direction of the negative gradient of <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">f(\theta)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.10764em;">f</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span> to minimize the function.</p>
<p data-start="656" data-end="754" class="">It is commonly used for minimizing <strong data-start="691" data-end="709">cost functions</strong> (loss functions) in machine learning models.</p>
<hr data-start="756" data-end="759" class="">
<h2 data-start="761" data-end="800" class=""><strong data-start="764" data-end="800">2. Why is Gradient Descent Used?</strong></h2>
<p data-start="801" data-end="1137" class="">Most machine learning models require finding the optimal parameters that minimize the cost function. However, computing an analytical solution (like in linear regression using the Normal Equation) is computationally expensive for large datasets. <strong data-start="1047" data-end="1137">Gradient Descent provides an efficient way to find the optimal parameters iteratively.</strong></p>
<p data-start="1139" data-end="1228" class="">For example, in <strong data-start="1155" data-end="1176">Linear Regression</strong>, the cost function is the Mean Squared Error (MSE):</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfrac><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>m</mi></munderover><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>θ</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">J(\theta) = \frac{1}{2m} \sum_{i=1}^{m} (h_{\theta}(x_i) - y_i)^2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; <p data-start="1312" data-end="1355" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>θ</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h_{\theta}(x)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3361em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span> is the predicted value,</p>

<li data-start="1356" data-end="1386" class="">
<p data-start="1358" data-end="1386" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">y</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.625em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span></span></span></span> is the actual value,</p>

<li data-start="1387" data-end="1432" class="">
