</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="1434" data-end="1524" class="">Gradient Descent is used to find the values of <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span> that minimize <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">J(\theta)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span>.</p>
<hr data-start="1526" data-end="1529" class="">
<h2 data-start="1531" data-end="1572" class=""><strong data-start="1534" data-end="1572">3. How Does Gradient Descent Work?</strong></h2>
<p data-start="1573" data-end="1652" class="">Gradient Descent updates parameters <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span> iteratively using the formula:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>α</mi><mo>⋅</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">∇</mi><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta = \theta - \alpha \cdot \nabla J(\theta)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7778em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4445em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">⋅</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">∇</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span>
<p data-start="1709" data-end="1715" class="">where:</p>
<ul data-start="1716" data-end="1909">
<li data-start="1716" data-end="1773" class="">
<p data-start="1718" data-end="1773" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span> represents the model parameters (weights),</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1774" data-end="1826" class="">
<p data-start="1776" data-end="1826" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\alpha</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span></span></span></span> is the <strong data-start="1796" data-end="1813">learning rate</strong> (step size),</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1827" data-end="1909" class="">
<p data-start="1829" data-end="1909" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∇</mi><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\nabla J(\theta)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">∇</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span> is the <strong data-start="1859" data-end="1871">gradient</strong> of the cost function <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">J(\theta)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="1911" data-end="1939" class=""><strong data-start="1915" data-end="1939">Gradient Calculation</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1940" data-end="1991" class="">The gradient <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∇</mi><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\nabla J(\theta)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">∇</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span> is computed as:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∂</mi><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∂</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{\partial J(\theta)}{\partial \theta}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.113em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.427em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord" style="margin-right: 0.05556em;">∂</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord" style="margin-right: 0.05556em;">∂</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span>
<p data-start="2043" data-end="2095" class="">For example, in linear regression with one variable:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><mi>α</mi><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>m</mi></mfrac><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>m</mi></munderover><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>θ</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta_j = \theta_j - \alpha \frac{1}{m} \sum_{i=1}^{m} (h_{\theta}(x_i) - y_i) x_i</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.9805em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0278em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.05724em;">j</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.9805em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0278em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.05724em;">j</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.9291em; vertical-align: -1.2777em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3214em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mop op-limits"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.6514em;"><span style="top: -1.8723em; margin-left: 0em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span><span class="mrel mtight">=</span><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span><span class="mop op-symbol large-op">∑</span></span></span><span style="top: -4.3em; margin-left: 0em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">m</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.2777em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3361em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0359em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>
<p data-start="2188" data-end="2312" class="">Each update step moves the parameters in the direction of the negative gradient, which leads to a lower cost function value.</p>
<hr data-start="2314" data-end="2317" class="">
<h2 data-start="2319" data-end="2354" class=""><strong data-start="2322" data-end="2354">4. Types of Gradient Descent</strong></h2>
<p data-start="2355" data-end="2431" class="">Gradient Descent has three main types based on how the gradient is computed.</p>
<h3 data-start="2433" data-end="2467" class=""><strong data-start="2437" data-end="2467">(a) Batch Gradient Descent</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="2468" data-end="2711">
<li data-start="2468" data-end="2518" class="">
<p data-start="2470" data-end="2518" class="">Uses the entire dataset to compute the gradient.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2519" data-end="2616" class="">
<p data-start="2521" data-end="2529" class="">Formula:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>α</mi><mo>⋅</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>m</mi></mfrac><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>m</mi></munderover><mi mathvariant="normal">∇</mi><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta = \theta - \alpha \cdot \frac{1}{m} \sum_{i=1}^{m} \nabla J(\theta)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7778em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4445em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">⋅</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.9291em; vertical-align: -1.2777em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3214em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mop op-limits"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.6514em;"><span style="top: -1.8723em; margin-left: 0em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span><span class="mrel mtight">=</span><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span><span class="mop op-symbol large-op">∑</span></span></span><span style="top: -4.3em; margin-left: 0em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">m</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.2777em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord">∇</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span>
</li>
<li data-start="2617" data-end="2653" class="">
<p data-start="2619" data-end="2653" class=""><strong data-start="2619" data-end="2627">Pros</strong>: More stable convergence.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2654" data-end="2711" class="">
<p data-start="2656" data-end="2711" class=""><strong data-start="2656" data-end="2664">Cons</strong>: Computationally expensive for large datasets.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="2713" data-end="2758" class=""><strong data-start="2717" data-end="2758">(b) Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD)</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="2759" data-end="3035">
<li data-start="2759" data-end="2820" class="">
<p data-start="2761" data-end="2820" class="">Updates parameters for each training example one at a time.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2821" data-end="2897" class="">
<p data-start="2823" data-end="2831" class="">Formula:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>α</mi><mo>⋅</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">∇</mi><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mi>θ</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>i</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta = \theta - \alpha \cdot \nabla J(\theta^{(i)})</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7778em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4445em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">⋅</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.188em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">∇</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.938em;"><span style="top: -3.113em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mopen mtight">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span><span class="mclose mtight">)</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span>
</li>
<li data-start="2898" data-end="2961" class="">
<p data-start="2900" data-end="2961" class=""><strong data-start="2900" data-end="2908">Pros</strong>: Faster updates, works well for very large datasets.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2962" data-end="3035" class="">
<p data-start="2964" data-end="3035" class=""><strong data-start="2964" data-end="2972">Cons</strong>: More variance in updates, might not always converge smoothly.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="3037" data-end="3076" class=""><strong data-start="3041" data-end="3076">(c) Mini-Batch Gradient Descent</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="3077" data-end="3340">
<li data-start="3077" data-end="3130" class="">
<p data-start="3079" data-end="3130" class="">Uses a small batch of data (instead of all or one).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3131" data-end="3234" class="">
<p data-start="3133" data-end="3141" class="">Formula:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>α</mi><mo>⋅</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>b</mi></mfrac><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>b</mi></munderover><mi mathvariant="normal">∇</mi><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mi>θ</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>i</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta = \theta - \alpha \cdot \frac{1}{b} \sum_{i=1}^{b} \nabla J(\theta^{(i)})</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7778em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4445em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">⋅</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 3.1138em; vertical-align: -1.2777em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3214em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">b</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mop op-limits"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.8361em;"><span style="top: -1.8723em; margin-left: 0em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span><span class="mrel mtight">=</span><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span><span class="mop op-symbol large-op">∑</span></span></span><span style="top: -4.3em; margin-left: 0em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">b</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.2777em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord">∇</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.938em;"><span style="top: -3.113em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mopen mtight">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span><span class="mclose mtight">)</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span>
</li>
<li data-start="3235" data-end="3281" class="">
<p data-start="3237" data-end="3281" class=""><strong data-start="3237" data-end="3245">Pros</strong>: Balances efficiency and stability.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3282" data-end="3340" class="">
<p data-start="3284" data-end="3340" class=""><strong data-start="3284" data-end="3292">Cons</strong>: Choosing an appropriate batch size is crucial.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="3342" data-end="3345" class="">
<h2 data-start="3347" data-end="3385" class=""><strong data-start="3350" data-end="3385">5. Learning Rate (<span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\alpha</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span></span></span></span>)</strong></h2>
<p data-start="3386" data-end="3489" class="">The <strong data-start="3390" data-end="3407">learning rate</strong> <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\alpha</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span></span></span></span> controls how big of a step gradient descent takes in each iteration.</p>
<h3 data-start="3491" data-end="3522" class=""><strong data-start="3495" data-end="3522">Effect of Learning Rate</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="3523" data-end="3719">
<li data-start="3523" data-end="3579" class="">
<p data-start="3525" data-end="3579" class=""><strong data-start="3525" data-end="3560">Too small (<span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\alpha</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span></span></span></span> is low)</strong>: Slow convergence.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3580" data-end="3652" class="">
<p data-start="3582" data-end="3652" class=""><strong data-start="3582" data-end="3618">Too large (<span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\alpha</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span></span></span></span> is high)</strong>: May overshoot or never converge.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3653" data-end="3719" class="">
<p data-start="3655" data-end="3719" class=""><strong data-start="3655" data-end="3679">Optimal <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\alpha</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span></span></span></span></strong>: Fast convergence without overshooting.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="3721" data-end="3753" class=""><strong data-start="3725" data-end="3753">Learning Rate Strategies</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="3754" data-end="3992">
<li data-start="3754" data-end="3814" class="">
<p data-start="3756" data-end="3814" class=""><strong data-start="3756" data-end="3779">Fixed Learning Rate</strong>: A constant value of <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\alpha</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3815" data-end="3925" class="">
<p data-start="3817" data-end="3925" class=""><strong data-start="3817" data-end="3843">Adaptive Learning Rate</strong>: Algorithms like <strong data-start="3861" data-end="3887">Adam, RMSprop, Adagrad</strong> adjust the learning rate dynamically.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3926" data-end="3992" class="">
<p data-start="3928" data-end="3992" class=""><strong data-start="3928" data-end="3956">Learning Rate Scheduling</strong>: Decreasing <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\alpha</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span></span></span></span> over time.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="3994" data-end="3997" class="">
<h2 data-start="3999" data-end="4040" class=""><strong data-start="4002" data-end="4040">6. Convergence of Gradient Descent</strong></h2>
<p data-start="4041" data-end="4174" class="">Gradient Descent is considered <strong data-start="4072" data-end="4085">converged</strong> when updates become very small or when the cost function stops decreasing significantly.</p>
<h3 data-start="4176" data-end="4208" class=""><strong data-start="4180" data-end="4208">Common Stopping Criteria</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="4209" data-end="4377">
<li data-start="4209" data-end="4281" class="">
<p data-start="4211" data-end="4281" class="">The <strong data-start="4215" data-end="4244">gradient is close to zero</strong>: <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∇</mi><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mo>&lt;</mo><mi>ϵ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">|\nabla J(\theta)| &lt; \epsilon</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">∣∇</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mord">∣</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">&lt;</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">ϵ</span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4282" data-end="4330" class="">
<p data-start="4284" data-end="4330" class="">The <strong data-start="4288" data-end="4329">change in cost function is very small</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4331" data-end="4377" class="">
<p data-start="4333" data-end="4377" class=""><strong data-start="4333" data-end="4365">Maximum number of iterations</strong> is reached.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="4379" data-end="4407" class=""><strong data-start="4383" data-end="4407">Checking Convergence</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="4408" data-end="4561">
<li data-start="4408" data-end="4471" class="">
<p data-start="4410" data-end="4471" class=""><strong data-start="4410" data-end="4440">Plotting the cost function</strong>: It should decrease over time.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4472" data-end="4561" class="">
<p data-start="4474" data-end="4561" class=""><strong data-start="4474" data-end="4506">Monitoring parameter updates</strong>: If updates become negligible, convergence is reached.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="4563" data-end="4566" class="">
<h2 data-start="4568" data-end="4608" class=""><strong data-start="4571" data-end="4608">7. Challenges in Gradient Descent</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="4609" data-end="4651" class=""><strong data-start="4613" data-end="4651">(a) Local Minima vs. Global Minima</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="4652" data-end="4863">
<li data-start="4652" data-end="4753" class="">
<p data-start="4654" data-end="4753" class="">In <strong data-start="4657" data-end="4677">convex functions</strong> (like linear regression), gradient descent always finds the global minimum.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4754" data-end="4863" class="">
<p data-start="4756" data-end="4863" class="">In <strong data-start="4759" data-end="4783">non-convex functions</strong> (like deep neural networks), gradient descent may get stuck in a local minimum.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="4865" data-end="4890" class=""><strong data-start="4869" data-end="4890">(b) Saddle Points</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="4891" data-end="5086">
<li data-start="4891" data-end="5000" class="">
<p data-start="4893" data-end="5000" class="">Gradient descent may slow down near <strong data-start="4929" data-end="4946">saddle points</strong> (where the gradient is zero but it is not a minimum).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5001" data-end="5086" class="">
<p data-start="5003" data-end="5086" class="">Advanced techniques like <strong data-start="5028" data-end="5059">momentum-based optimization</strong> help escape saddle points.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="5088" data-end="5115" class=""><strong data-start="5092" data-end="5115">(c) Feature Scaling</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="5116" data-end="5284">
<li data-start="5116" data-end="5188" class="">
<p data-start="5118" data-end="5188" class="">Gradient Descent <strong data-start="5135" data-end="5155">converges faster</strong> if features are scaled properly.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5189" data-end="5284" class="">
<p data-start="5191" data-end="5284" class="">Use <strong data-start="5195" data-end="5238">Standardization (Z-score normalization)</strong> or <strong data-start="5242" data-end="5261">Min-Max Scaling</strong> to normalize features.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="5286" data-end="5289" class="">
<h2 data-start="5291" data-end="5329" class=""><strong data-start="5294" data-end="5329">8. Variants of Gradient Descent</strong></h2>
<p data-start="5330" data-end="5385" class="">Several improvements to vanilla gradient descent exist:</p>
<h3 data-start="5387" data-end="5430" class=""><strong data-start="5391" data-end="5430">(a) Momentum-based Gradient Descent</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="5431" data-end="5639">
<li data-start="5431" data-end="5471" class="">
<p data-start="5433" data-end="5471" class="">Adds momentum to speed up convergence.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5472" data-end="5586" class="">
<p data-start="5474" data-end="5482" class="">Formula:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>t</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>β</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>β</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">∇</mi><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">v_t = \beta v_{t-1} + (1 - \beta) \nabla J(\theta)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5806em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">v</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.2806em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; vertical-align: -0.2083em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">v</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0359em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">t</span><span class="mbin mtight">−</span><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.2083em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.05278em;">β</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mord">∇</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span>

</li>
<li data-start="5587" data-end="5639" class="">
<p data-start="5589" data-end="5639" class="">Helps escape local minima and avoids oscillations.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="5641" data-end="5691" class=""><strong data-start="5645" data-end="5691">(b) RMSprop (Root Mean Square Propagation)</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="5692" data-end="5803">
<li data-start="5692" data-end="5756" class="">
<p data-start="5694" data-end="5756" class="">Uses an adaptive learning rate that depends on past gradients.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5757" data-end="5803" class="">
<p data-start="5759" data-end="5803" class="">Prevents drastic learning rate fluctuations.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="5805" data-end="5850" class=""><strong data-start="5809" data-end="5850">(c) Adam (Adaptive Moment Estimation)</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="5851" data-end="5946">
<li data-start="5851" data-end="5891" class="">
<p data-start="5853" data-end="5891" class="">Combines <strong data-start="5862" data-end="5874">Momentum</strong> and <strong data-start="5879" data-end="5890">RMSprop</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5892" data-end="5946" class="">
<p data-start="5894" data-end="5946" class="">One of the most popular optimizers in deep learning.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="5948" data-end="5951" class="">
<h2 data-start="5953" data-end="5995" class=""><strong data-start="5956" data-end="5995">9. Applications of Gradient Descent</strong></h2>
<p data-start="5996" data-end="6084" class="">Gradient Descent is used in many machine learning and deep learning algorithms, such as:</p>
<ul data-start="6085" data-end="6268">
<li data-start="6085" data-end="6119" class="">
<p data-start="6087" data-end="6119" class=""><strong data-start="6087" data-end="6119">Linear &amp; Logistic Regression</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6120" data-end="6157" class="">
<p data-start="6122" data-end="6157" class=""><strong data-start="6122" data-end="6157">Neural Networks (Deep Learning)</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6158" data-end="6193" class="">
<p data-start="6160" data-end="6193" class=""><strong data-start="6160" data-end="6193">Support Vector Machines (SVM)</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6194" data-end="6233" class="">
<p data-start="6196" data-end="6233" class=""><strong data-start="6196" data-end="6233">Natural Language Processing (NLP)</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6234" data-end="6268" class="">
<p data-start="6236" data-end="6268" class=""><strong data-start="6236" data-end="6268">Computer Vision (CNNs, GANs)</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="6270" data-end="6273" class="">
<h2 data-start="6275" data-end="6293" class=""><strong data-start="6278" data-end="6293">10. Summary</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="6294" data-end="6315" class=""><strong data-start="6298" data-end="6315">Key Takeaways</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="6316" data-end="6730">
<li data-start="6316" data-end="6396" class="">
<p data-start="6318" data-end="6396" class="">Gradient Descent is an optimization algorithm used to minimize cost functions.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6397" data-end="6485" class="">
<p data-start="6399" data-end="6485" class="">It works by iteratively updating parameters in the direction of the negative gradient.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6486" data-end="6553" class="">
<p data-start="6488" data-end="6553" class="">The <strong data-start="6492" data-end="6509">learning rate</strong> controls step size and affects convergence.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6554" data-end="6621" class="">
<p data-start="6556" data-end="6621" class=""><strong data-start="6556" data-end="6585">Types of Gradient Descent</strong>: Batch, Stochastic, and Mini-Batch.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6622" data-end="6689" class="">
<p data-start="6624" data-end="6689" class=""><strong data-start="6624" data-end="6638">Challenges</strong>: Local minima, saddle points, and feature scaling.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6690" data-end="6730" class="">
<p data-start="6692" data-end="6730" class=""><strong data-start="6692" data-end="6704">Variants</strong>: Momentum, RMSprop, Adam.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="6732" data-end="6735" class="">
<p data-start="6737" data-end="6902" class="">Gradient Descent is the foundation of many machine learning and deep learning algorithms. dark:prose-invert dark"><h3 data-start="0" data-end="37" class=""><strong data-start="4" data-end="35">Regularization: A Deep Dive</strong></h3>
<p data-start="39" data-end="256" class="">Regularization is a technique used in machine learning to <strong data-start="97" data-end="119">reduce overfitting</strong> by adding a penalty term to the cost function. It helps improve the generalization of the model by discouraging overly complex models.</p>
<hr data-start="258" data-end="261" class="">
<h2 data-start="263" data-end="305" class=""><strong data-start="266" data-end="303">1. Why Do We Need Regularization?</strong></h2>
<p data-start="306" data-end="419" class="">In machine learning, we aim to create models that perform well on unseen data. However, models can suffer from:</p>
<ul data-start="420" data-end="624">
<li data-start="420" data-end="522" class="">
<p data-start="422" data-end="522" class=""><strong data-start="422" data-end="437">Overfitting</strong> (High Variance): The model performs well on training data but poorly on test data.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="523" data-end="624" class="">
<p data-start="525" data-end="624" class=""><strong data-start="525" data-end="541">Underfitting</strong> (High Bias): The model is too simple and cannot capture the underlying patterns.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="626" data-end="742" class="">Regularization <strong data-start="641" data-end="670">helps prevent overfitting</strong> by <strong data-start="674" data-end="703">reducing model complexity</strong> while still maintaining good accuracy.</p>
<hr data-start="744" data-end="747" class="">
<h2 data-start="749" data-end="786" class=""><strong data-start="752" data-end="784">2. How Regularization Works?</strong></h2>
<p data-start="787" data-end="959" class="">Regularization modifies the <strong data-start="815" data-end="832">cost function</strong> by adding a <strong data-start="845" data-end="861">penalty term</strong> that discourages large parameter values (weights). The general form of regularized cost function:</p>

</li>
<li data-start="1191" data-end="1274" class="">
<p data-start="1193" data-end="1274" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>λ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\lambda</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">λ</span></span></span></span> (regularization parameter) controls the strength of regularization.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1275" data-end="1342" class="">
<p data-start="1277" data-end="1342" class=""><strong data-start="1277" data-end="1293">Penalty term</strong> is usually based on the sum of model parameters.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="1344" data-end="1445" class="">If <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>λ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\lambda</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">λ</span></span></span></span> is too high, the model may <strong data-start="1388" data-end="1400">underfit</strong>; if it’s too low, the model may <strong data-start="1433" data-end="1444">overfit</strong>.</p>
<hr data-start="1447" data-end="1450" class="">
<h2 data-start="1452" data-end="1485" class=""><strong data-start="1455" data-end="1485">3. Types of Regularization</strong></h2>
<p data-start="1486" data-end="1529" class="">There are two main types of regularization:</p>
<ol data-start="1531" data-end="1679">
<li data-start="1531" data-end="1574" class="">
<p data-start="1534" data-end="1574" class=""><strong data-start="1534" data-end="1574">L1 Regularization (Lasso Regression)</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1575" data-end="1620" class="">
<p data-start="1578" data-end="1620" class=""><strong data-start="1578" data-end="1618">L2 Regularization (Ridge Regression)</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1621" data-end="1679" class="">
<p data-start="1624" data-end="1679" class=""><strong data-start="1624" data-end="1654">Elastic Net Regularization</strong> (Combination of L1 &amp; L2)</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="1681" data-end="1684" class="">
<h2 data-start="1686" data-end="1732" class=""><strong data-start="1689" data-end="1732">4. L1 Regularization (Lasso Regression)</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="1733" data-end="1749" class=""><strong data-start="1737" data-end="1749">Concept:</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="1750" data-end="1881">
<li data-start="1750" data-end="1840" class="">
<p data-start="1752" data-end="1840" class="">L1 Regularization <strong data-start="1770" data-end="1798">adds the absolute values</strong> of the coefficients to the cost function.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1841" data-end="1881" class="">
<p data-start="1843" data-end="1881" class="">Formula for regularized cost function:</p>
</li>
</ul>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>m</mi></mfrac><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>m</mi></munderover><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>θ</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>λ</mi><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>n</mi></munderover><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">J(\theta) = \frac{1}{m} \sum_{i=1}^{m} (h_{\theta}(x_i) - y_i)^2 + \lambda \sum_{j=1}^{n} |\theta_j|</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; <p data-start="1991" data-end="1997" class="">where:</p>
<ul data-start="1998" data-end="2061">
<li data-start="1998" data-end="2061" class="">
<p data-start="2000" data-end="2061" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">|\theta_j|</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.0361em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mord">∣</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0278em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.05724em;">j</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord">∣</span></span></span></span> is the <strong data-start="2024" data-end="2042">absolute value</strong> of the parameters.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="2063" data-end="2099" class=""><strong data-start="2067" data-end="2099">Effect of L1 Regularization:</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="2100" data-end="2417">
<li data-start="2100" data-end="2212" class="">
<p data-start="2102" data-end="2212" class=""><strong data-start="2102" data-end="2123">Feature Selection</strong>: It shrinks some coefficients <strong data-start="2154" data-end="2165">to zero</strong>, effectively <strong data-start="2179" data-end="2211">removing irrelevant features</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2213" data-end="2289" class="">
<p data-start="2215" data-end="2289" class=""><strong data-start="2215" data-end="2232">Sparse Models</strong>: Good for cases where only a few features are important.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2290" data-end="2417" class="">
<p data-start="2292" data-end="2417" class=""><strong data-start="2292" data-end="2325">Non-Differentiability at Zero</strong>: Because of the absolute value, optimization methods like <strong data-start="2384" data-end="2407">Subgradient Descent</strong> are used.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="2419" data-end="2435" class=""><strong data-start="2423" data-end="2435">Example:</strong></h3>
<p data-start="2436" data-end="2588" class="">Lasso Regression is useful when you want to identify <strong data-start="2489" data-end="2511">important features</strong> in high-dimensional datasets (e.g., feature selection in medical diagnosis).</p>
<hr data-start="2590" data-end="2593" class="">
<h2 data-start="2595" data-end="2641" class=""><strong data-start="2598" data-end="2641">5. L2 Regularization (Ridge Regression)</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="2642" data-end="2658" class=""><strong data-start="2646" data-end="2658">Concept:</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="2659" data-end="2759">
<li data-start="2659" data-end="2748" class="">
<p data-start="2661" data-end="2748" class="">L2 Regularization <strong data-start="2679" data-end="2706">adds the squared values</strong> of the coefficients to the cost function.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2749" data-end="2759" class="">
<p data-start="2751" data-end="2759" class="">Formula:</p>
</li>
</ul>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>m</mi></mfrac><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>m</mi></munderover><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>θ</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>λ</mi><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>n</mi></munderover><msubsup><mi>θ</mi><mi>j</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">J(\theta) = \frac{1}{m} \sum_{i=1}^{m} (h_{\theta}(x_i) - y_i)^2 + \lambda \sum_{j=1}^{n} \theta_j^2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3831em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>
<h3 data-start="2869" data-end="2905" class=""><strong data-start="2873" data-end="2905">Effect of L2 Regularization:</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="2906" data-end="3086">
<li data-start="2906" data-end="2978" class="">
<p data-start="2908" data-end="2978" class=""><strong data-start="2908" data-end="2964">Does not eliminate features but shrinks coefficients</strong> towards zero.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2979" data-end="3036" class="">
<p data-start="2981" data-end="3036" class=""><strong data-start="2981" data-end="3005">Prevents overfitting</strong> by discouraging large weights.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3037" data-end="3086" class="">
<p data-start="3039" data-end="3086" class=""><strong data-start="3039" data-end="3085">Works well when all features are important</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="3088" data-end="3104" class=""><strong data-start="3092" data-end="3104">Example:</strong></h3>
<p data-start="3105" data-end="3230" class="">Ridge Regression is useful when all features contribute <strong data-start="3161" data-end="3173">somewhat</strong> to the target variable (e.g., forecasting stock prices).</p>
<hr data-start="3232" data-end="3235" class="">
<h2 data-start="3237" data-end="3283" class=""><strong data-start="3240" data-end="3283">6. Elastic Net Regularization (L1 + L2)</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="3284" data-end="3300" class=""><strong data-start="3288" data-end="3300">Concept:</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="3301" data-end="3353">
<li data-start="3301" data-end="3336" class="">
<p data-start="3303" data-end="3336" class=""><strong data-start="3303" data-end="3325">Combines L1 and L2</strong> penalties.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3337" data-end="3353" class="">
<p data-start="3339" data-end="3353" class="">Cost function:</p>
</li>
</ul>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>m</mi></mfrac><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>m</mi></munderover><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>θ</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>n</mi></munderover><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>j</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>n</mi></munderover><msubsup><mi>θ</mi><mi>j</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">J(\theta) = \frac{1}{m} \sum_{i=1}^{m} (h_{\theta}(x_i) - y_i)^2 + \lambda_1 \sum_{j=1}^{n} |\theta_j| + \lambda_2 \sum_{j=1}^{n} \theta_j^2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; <p data-start="3503" data-end="3509" class="">where:</p>
<ul data-start="3510" data-end="3617">
<li data-start="3510" data-end="3563" class="">
<p data-start="3512" data-end="3563" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\lambda_1</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8444em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">λ</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> controls L1 regularization (Lasso).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3564" data-end="3617" class="">
<p data-start="3566" data-end="3617" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\lambda_2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8444em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">λ</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> controls L2 regularization (Ridge).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="3619" data-end="3649" class=""><strong data-start="3623" data-end="3649">Effect of Elastic Net:</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="3650" data-end="3853">
<li data-start="3650" data-end="3714" class="">
<p data-start="3652" data-end="3714" class=""><strong data-start="3652" data-end="3688">Handles correlated features well</strong> (L1 struggles with this).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3715" data-end="3770" class="">
<p data-start="3717" data-end="3770" class=""><strong data-start="3717" data-end="3769">Selects features while reducing model complexity</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3771" data-end="3853" class="">
<p data-start="3773" data-end="3853" class=""><strong data-start="3773" data-end="3852">Works better than Lasso in some cases where Lasso removes too many features</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="3855" data-end="3871" class=""><strong data-start="3859" data-end="3871">Example:</strong></h3>
<p data-start="3872" data-end="3950" class="">Used in <strong data-start="3880" data-end="3909">high-dimensional datasets</strong> where there are many redundant features.</p>
<hr data-start="3952" data-end="3955" class="">
<h2 data-start="3957" data-end="4004" class=""><strong data-start="3960" data-end="4004">7. Comparison of L1, L2, and Elastic Net</strong></h2>
<div class="overflow-x-auto contain-inline-size"><table data-start="4005" data-end="4374" node="[object Object]"><thead data-start="4005" data-end="4103"><tr data-start="4005" data-end="4103"><th data-start="4005" data-end="4027">Regularization Type</th><th data-start="4027" data-end="4051">Shrinks Coefficients?</th><th data-start="4051" data-end="4085">Sets Some Coefficients to Zero?</th><th data-start="4085" data-end="4103">Works Well For</th></tr></thead><tbody data-start="4194" data-end="4374"><tr data-start="4194" data-end="4244"><td><strong data-start="4196" data-end="4210">L1 (Lasso)</strong></td><td>Yes</td><td>Yes</td><td>Feature selection</td></tr><tr data-start="4245" data-end="4299"><td><strong data-start="4247" data-end="4261">L2 (Ridge)</strong></td><td>Yes</td><td>No</td><td>Preventing overfitting</td></tr><tr data-start="4300" data-end="4374"><td><strong data-start="4302" data-end="4317">Elastic Net</strong></td><td>Yes</td><td>Yes (partially)</td><td>Handling correlated features</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<hr data-start="4376" data-end="4379" class="">
<h2 data-start="4381" data-end="4441" class=""><strong data-start="4384" data-end="4441">8. Impact of Regularization Parameter (<span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>λ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\lambda</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">λ</span></span></span></span>)</strong></h2>
<ul data-start="4442" data-end="4642">
<li data-start="4442" data-end="4509" class="">
<p data-start="4444" data-end="4509" class=""><strong data-start="4444" data-end="4467">Small <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>λ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\lambda</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">λ</span></span></span></span></strong> → Less regularization, model may overfit.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4510" data-end="4578" class="">
<p data-start="4512" data-end="4578" class=""><strong data-start="4512" data-end="4535">Large <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>λ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\lambda</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">λ</span></span></span></span></strong> → More regularization, model may underfit.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4579" data-end="4642" class="">
<p data-start="4581" data-end="4642" class=""><strong data-start="4581" data-end="4606">Optimal <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>λ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\lambda</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">λ</span></span></span></span></strong> → Found using <strong data-start="4621" data-end="4641">Cross-Validation</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="4644" data-end="4647" class="">
<h2 data-start="4649" data-end="4706" class=""><strong data-start="4652" data-end="4706">9. Regularization in Other Machine Learning Models</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="4707" data-end="4734" class=""><strong data-start="4711" data-end="4734">Logistic Regression</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="4735" data-end="4875">
<li data-start="4735" data-end="4809" class="">
<p data-start="4737" data-end="4809" class="">Regularization helps <strong data-start="4758" data-end="4781">prevent overfitting</strong> in classification problems.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4810" data-end="4875" class="">
<p data-start="4812" data-end="4875" class="">Uses <strong data-start="4817" data-end="4843">L1, L2, or Elastic Net</strong> just like in linear regression.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="4877" data-end="4900" class=""><strong data-start="4881" data-end="4900">Neural Networks</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="4901" data-end="5090">
<li data-start="4901" data-end="4979" class="">
<p data-start="4903" data-end="4979" class=""><strong data-start="4903" data-end="4927">L1/L2 Regularization</strong>: Helps prevent overfitting in deep learning models.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4980" data-end="5090" class="">
<p data-start="4982" data-end="5090" class=""><strong data-start="4982" data-end="5008">Dropout Regularization</strong>: Randomly drops some neurons during training to avoid reliance on specific nodes.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="5092" data-end="5131" class=""><strong data-start="5096" data-end="5131">Decision Trees &amp; Random Forests</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="5132" data-end="5209">
<li data-start="5132" data-end="5209" class="">
<p data-start="5134" data-end="5209" class=""><strong data-start="5134" data-end="5145">Pruning</strong> acts as a regularization method to remove unnecessary branches.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="5211" data-end="5214" class="">
<h2 data-start="5216" data-end="5266" class=""><strong data-start="5219" data-end="5266">10. How to Choose the Right Regularization?</strong></h2>
<div class="overflow-x-auto contain-inline-size"><table data-start="5267" data-end="5541" node="[object Object]"><thead data-start="5267" data-end="5302"><tr data-start="5267" data-end="5302"><th data-start="5267" data-end="5279">Situation</th><th data-start="5279" data-end="5302">Best Regularization</th></tr></thead><tbody data-start="5338" data-end="5541"><tr data-start="5338" data-end="5379"><td>Many irrelevant features</td><td>L1 (Lasso)</td></tr><tr data-start="5380" data-end="5417"><td>Correlated features</td><td>Elastic Net</td></tr><tr data-start="5418" data-end="5492"><td>Preventing large coefficients without feature elimination</td><td>L2 (Ridge)</td></tr><tr data-start="5493" data-end="5541"><td>Complex, high-dimensional data</td><td>Elastic Net</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<hr data-start="5543" data-end="5546" class="">
<h2 data-start="5548" data-end="5569" class=""><strong data-start="5551" data-end="5569">11. Conclusion</strong></h2>
<ul data-start="5570" data-end="5921">
<li data-start="5570" data-end="5645" class="">
<p data-start="5572" data-end="5645" class="">Regularization <strong data-start="5587" data-end="5611">prevents overfitting</strong> by penalizing large coefficients.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5646" data-end="5742" class="">
<p data-start="5648" data-end="5742" class=""><strong data-start="5648" data-end="5662">L1 (Lasso)</strong> removes features, <strong data-start="5681" data-end="5695">L2 (Ridge)</strong> shrinks them, and <strong data-start="5714" data-end="5729">Elastic Net</strong> is a hybrid.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5743" data-end="5826" class="">
<p data-start="5745" data-end="5826" class="">Choosing the right <strong data-start="5764" data-end="5782">regularization</strong> depends on the <strong data-start="5798" data-end="5825">dataset characteristics</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5827" data-end="5921" class="">
<p data-start="5829" data-end="5921" class="">Regularization is crucial in <strong data-start="5858" data-end="5894">machine learning &amp; deep learning</strong> to improve generalization.</p>
</li>
</ul>

dark:prose-invert dark"><h1 data-start="0" data-end="40" class=""><strong data-start="2" data-end="38">Logistic Regression: A Deep Dive</strong></h1>
<p data-start="42" data-end="292" class="">Logistic Regression is a <strong data-start="67" data-end="100">supervised learning algorithm</strong> used for <strong data-start="110" data-end="135">binary classification</strong> problems. Unlike Linear Regression, which predicts continuous values, Logistic Regression predicts <strong data-start="235" data-end="252">probabilities</strong> and maps them to discrete class labels.</p>
<hr data-start="294" data-end="297" class="">
<h2 data-start="299" data-end="344" class=""><strong data-start="302" data-end="344">1. Why Do We Need Logistic Regression?</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="345" data-end="404" class=""><strong data-start="349" data-end="402">Problem with Linear Regression for Classification</strong></h3>
<p data-start="405" data-end="599" class="">In binary classification (e.g., spam vs. not spam), we need an output in the range <strong data-start="488" data-end="497">[0,1]</strong>. However, Linear Regression gives values outside this range, making it unsuitable for classification.</p>
<h3 data-start="601" data-end="646" class=""><strong data-start="605" data-end="646">Solution: Logistic Function (Sigmoid)</strong></h3>
<p data-start="647" data-end="739" class="">Logistic Regression solves this by applying the <strong data-start="695" data-end="715">Sigmoid Function</strong> to the linear equation:</p>

<p data-start="794" data-end="902" class="">This ensures the output is always between <strong data-start="836" data-end="847">0 and 1</strong>, representing the probability of belonging to class 1.</p>
<hr data-start="904" data-end="907" class="">
<h2 data-start="909" data-end="966" class=""><strong data-start="912" data-end="966">2. Mathematical Formulation of Logistic Regression</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="967" data-end="1007" class=""><strong data-start="971" data-end="1007">1. Hypothesis Function (Sigmoid)</strong></h3>
