<p data-start="1164" data-end="1170" class="">where:</p>
<ul data-start="1171" data-end="1338">
<li data-start="1171" data-end="1253" class="">
<p data-start="1173" data-end="1253" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>θ</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h_{\theta}(x)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3361em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span> is the probability that the instance belongs to <strong data-start="1241" data-end="1252">class 1</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1254" data-end="1304" class="">
<p data-start="1256" data-end="1304" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span> are the model parameters (weights).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1305" data-end="1338" class="">
<p data-start="1307" data-end="1338" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">x</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span></span></span></span> are the input features.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="1340" data-end="1343" class="">If:</p>
<ul data-start="1344" data-end="1442">
<li data-start="1344" data-end="1394" class="">
<p data-start="1346" data-end="1394" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>θ</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>≥</mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h_{\theta}(x) \geq 0.5</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3361em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">≥</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">0.5</span></span></span></span>, classify as <strong data-start="1388" data-end="1393">1</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1395" data-end="1442" class="">
<p data-start="1397" data-end="1442" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>θ</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>&lt;</mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h_{\theta}(x) &lt; 0.5</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3361em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">&lt;</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">0.5</span></span></span></span>, classify as <strong data-start="1436" data-end="1441">0</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1444" data-end="1447" class="">
<h3 data-start="1449" data-end="1497" class=""><strong data-start="1453" data-end="1497">2. Cost Function for Logistic Regression</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1498" data-end="1634" class="">In Linear Regression, we use <strong data-start="1527" data-end="1555">Mean Squared Error (MSE)</strong>, but for Logistic Regression, we use <strong data-start="1593" data-end="1634">Log Loss (Binary Cross-Entropy Loss):</strong></p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>m</mi></mfrac><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>m</mi></munderover><mrow><mo fence="true">[</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>θ</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>θ</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo fence="true">]</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">J(\theta) = -\frac{1}{m} \sum_{i=1}^{m} \left[ y_i \log(h_{\theta}(x_i)) + (1 - y_i) \log(1 - h_{\theta}(x_i)) \right]</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.9291em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">))</span><span class="mclose delimcenter" style="top: 0em;">]</span></span></span></span></span></span>
<p data-start="1762" data-end="1768" class="">where:</p>
<ul data-start="1769" data-end="1916">
<li data-start="1769" data-end="1816" class="">
<p data-start="1771" data-end="1816" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>y</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">y_i</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.625em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0359em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> is the actual class label (0 or 1).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1817" data-end="1870" class="">
<p data-start="1819" data-end="1870" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>θ</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h_{\theta}(x_i)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3361em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span> is the predicted probability.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1871" data-end="1916" class="">
<p data-start="1873" data-end="1916" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">m</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span></span></span></span> is the number of training examples.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="1918" data-end="1937" class="">This cost function:</p>
<ul data-start="1938" data-end="2067">
<li data-start="1938" data-end="2005" class="">
<p data-start="1940" data-end="2005" class=""><strong data-start="1940" data-end="1980">Penalizes incorrect predictions more</strong> when confidence is high.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2006" data-end="2067" class="">
<p data-start="2008" data-end="2067" class=""><strong data-start="2008" data-end="2066">Encourages correct class probabilities close to 1 or 0</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="2069" data-end="2072" class="">
<h3 data-start="2074" data-end="2120" class=""><strong data-start="2078" data-end="2120">3. Optimization Using Gradient Descent</strong></h3>
<p data-start="2121" data-end="2210" class="">We minimize the cost function using <strong data-start="2157" data-end="2177">Gradient Descent</strong>, where we update the parameters:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>:</mo><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><mi>α</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∂</mi><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∂</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>j</mi></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta_j := \theta_j - \alpha \frac{\partial J(\theta)}{\partial \theta_j}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.9805em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0278em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.05724em;">j</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">:=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.9805em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0278em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.05724em;">j</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.3991em; vertical-align: -0.9721em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.0037em;">α</span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.427em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord" style="margin-right: 0.05556em;">∂</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0278em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.05724em;">j</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord" style="margin-right: 0.05556em;">∂</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.9721em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span>
<p data-start="2294" data-end="2300" class="">where:</p>
<ul data-start="2301" data-end="2381">
<li data-start="2301" data-end="2341" class="">

</li>
<li data-start="2342" data-end="2381" class="">
<p data-start="2344" data-end="2381" class="">The gradient of the cost function is:</p>
</li>
</ul>

<p data-start="2495" data-end="2550" class="">This updates the weights iteratively until convergence.</p>
<hr data-start="2552" data-end="2555" class="">
<h2 data-start="2557" data-end="2607" class=""><strong data-start="2560" data-end="2607">3. Decision Boundary in Logistic Regression</strong></h2>
<ul data-start="2608" data-end="2926">
<li data-start="2608" data-end="2689" class="">
<p data-start="2610" data-end="2689" class="">A <strong data-start="2612" data-end="2640">linear decision boundary</strong> is created by setting <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>θ</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h_{\theta}(x) = 0.5</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3361em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">0.5</span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2690" data-end="2830" class="">
<p data-start="2692" data-end="2774" class="">For a <strong data-start="2698" data-end="2723">binary classification</strong> problem with two features <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">x_1</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.5806em; <span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta_0 + \theta_1 x_1 + \theta_2 x_2 = 0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8444em; </li>
<li data-start="2832" data-end="2926" class="">
<p data-start="2834" data-end="2926" class="">This represents a <strong data-start="2852" data-end="2869">straight line</strong> (or hyperplane in higher dimensions) separating classes.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="2928" data-end="2931" class="">
<h2 data-start="2933" data-end="2971" class=""><strong data-start="2936" data-end="2971">4. Types of Logistic Regression</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="2972" data-end="3009" class=""><strong data-start="2976" data-end="3009">1. Binary Logistic Regression</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="3010" data-end="3116">
<li data-start="3010" data-end="3086" class="">
<p data-start="3012" data-end="3086" class="">Used for <strong data-start="3021" data-end="3043">two-class problems</strong> (e.g., spam detection: spam vs. not spam).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3087" data-end="3116" class="">
<p data-start="3089" data-end="3116" class="">Output: <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">0</span></span></span></span> or <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="3118" data-end="3160" class=""><strong data-start="3122" data-end="3160">2. Multinomial Logistic Regression</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="3161" data-end="3358">
<li data-start="3161" data-end="3244" class="">
<p data-start="3163" data-end="3244" class="">Used for <strong data-start="3172" data-end="3202">multi-class classification</strong> when there are <strong data-start="3218" data-end="3243">three or more classes</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3245" data-end="3296" class="">
<p data-start="3247" data-end="3296" class="">Uses the <strong data-start="3256" data-end="3276">softmax function</strong> instead of sigmoid.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3297" data-end="3358" class="">
<p data-start="3299" data-end="3358" class="">Example: Classifying emails as <strong data-start="3330" data-end="3357">Work, Personal, or Spam</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="3360" data-end="3398" class=""><strong data-start="3364" data-end="3398">3. Ordinal Logistic Regression</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="3399" data-end="3492">
<li data-start="3399" data-end="3492" class="">
<p data-start="3401" data-end="3492" class="">Used when output classes have a <strong data-start="3433" data-end="3450">natural order</strong> (e.g., rating system: low, medium, high).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="3494" data-end="3497" class="">
<h2 data-start="3499" data-end="3546" class=""><strong data-start="3502" data-end="3546">5. Regularization in Logistic Regression</strong></h2>
<p data-start="3547" data-end="3625" class="">To prevent <strong data-start="3558" data-end="3573">overfitting</strong>, we add a regularization term to the cost function.</p>
<h3 data-start="3627" data-end="3660" class=""><strong data-start="3631" data-end="3660">L2 Regularization (Ridge)</strong></h3>

<li data-start="3823" data-end="3852" class="">
<p data-start="3825" data-end="3852" class=""><strong data-start="3825" data-end="3851">Prevents large weights</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3853" data-end="3884" class="">
<p data-start="3855" data-end="3884" class=""><strong data-start="3855" data-end="3883">Reduces model complexity</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="3886" data-end="3919" class=""><strong data-start="3890" data-end="3919">L1 Regularization (Lasso)</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="3920" data-end="4038">
<li data-start="3920" data-end="3980" class="">
<p data-start="3922" data-end="3980" class="">Shrinks some coefficients to <strong data-start="3951" data-end="3959">zero</strong> → Feature selection.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3981" data-end="4038" class="">
<p data-start="3983" data-end="4038" class="">Helps in <strong data-start="3992" data-end="4009">sparse models</strong> (high-dimensional datasets).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="4040" data-end="4043" class="">
<h2 data-start="4045" data-end="4106" class=""><strong data-start="4048" data-end="4106">6. Advantages and Disadvantages of Logistic Regression</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="4107" data-end="4127" class="">✅ <strong data-start="4113" data-end="4127">Advantages</strong></h3>
<p data-start="4128" data-end="4346" class="">✔️ <strong data-start="4131" data-end="4157">Simple &amp; Interpretable</strong> – Easy to understand.<br data-start="4179" data-end="4182">
✔️ <strong data-start="4185" data-end="4202">Fast Training</strong> – Computationally efficient.<br data-start="4231" data-end="4234">
✔️ <strong data-start="4237" data-end="4279">Works Well for Linearly Separable Data</strong>.<br data-start="4280" data-end="4283">
✔️ <strong data-start="4286" data-end="4311">Outputs Probabilities</strong> – Useful for confidence scoring.</p>
<h3 data-start="4348" data-end="4371" class="">❌ <strong data-start="4354" data-end="4371">Disadvantages</strong></h3>
<p data-start="4372" data-end="4609" class="">❌ <strong data-start="4374" data-end="4410">Assumes Linear Decision Boundary</strong> – Cannot model complex relationships.<br data-start="4448" data-end="4451">
❌ <strong data-start="4453" data-end="4478">Sensitive to Outliers</strong> – Outliers affect decision boundaries.<br data-start="4517" data-end="4520">
❌ <strong data-start="4522" data-end="4560">Not Good for High-Dimensional Data</strong> – Performance degrades with too many features.</p>
<hr data-start="4611" data-end="4614" class="">
<h2 data-start="4616" data-end="4666" class=""><strong data-start="4619" data-end="4666">7. Logistic Regression vs. Other Algorithms</strong></h2>
<div class="overflow-x-auto contain-inline-size"><table data-start="4667" data-end="5078" node="[object Object]"><thead data-start="4667" data-end="4722"><tr data-start="4667" data-end="4722"><th data-start="4667" data-end="4677">Feature</th><th data-start="4677" data-end="4699">Logistic Regression</th><th data-start="4699" data-end="4715">Decision Tree</th><th data-start="4715" data-end="4722">SVM</th></tr></thead><tbody data-start="4777" data-end="5078"><tr data-start="4777" data-end="4826"><td><strong data-start="4779" data-end="4799">Interpretability</strong></td><td>High</td><td>Medium</td><td>Medium</td></tr><tr data-start="4827" data-end="4897"><td><strong data-start="4829" data-end="4872">Works Well for Linearly Separable Data?</strong></td><td>✅ Yes</td><td>❌ No</td><td>✅ Yes</td></tr><tr data-start="4898" data-end="4965"><td><strong data-start="4900" data-end="4926">Handles Non-linearity?</strong></td><td>❌ No</td><td>✅ Yes</td><td>✅ Yes (with Kernel)</td></tr><tr data-start="4966" data-end="5029"><td><strong data-start="4968" data-end="4995">Regularization Support?</strong></td><td>✅ Yes (L1, L2)</td><td>❌ No</td><td>✅ Yes</td></tr><tr data-start="5030" data-end="5078"><td><strong data-start="5032" data-end="5054">Computational Cost</strong></td><td>Low</td><td>Medium</td><td>High</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> np
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> pandas </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> pd
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> sklearn.model_selection </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> train_test_split
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> sklearn.linear_model </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> LogisticRegression
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> sklearn.metrics </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> accuracy_score

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Generate sample data</span></span><span>
np.random.seed(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">42</span></span><span>)
X = np.random.rand(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">100</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># 100 samples, 2 features</span></span><span>
y = (X[:, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>] + X[:, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>] &gt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>).astype(</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Simple decision boundary</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Train-test split</span></span><span>
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.2</span></span><span>, random_state=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">42</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Logistic Regression Model</span></span><span>
model = LogisticRegression()
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Predictions</span></span><span>
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Accuracy</span></span><span>
accuracy = accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"Accuracy: <span class="hljs-subst">{accuracy * <span class="hljs-number">100</span></span></span></span><span>:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.2</span></span><span>f}%")
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="5852" data-end="5855" class="">
<h2 data-start="5857" data-end="5874" class=""><strong data-start="5860" data-end="5874">9. Summary</strong></h2>
<ol data-start="5875" data-end="6246">
<li data-start="5875" data-end="5988" class="">
<p data-start="5878" data-end="5988" class=""><strong data-start="5878" data-end="5901">Logistic Regression</strong> is a classification algorithm using the <strong data-start="5942" data-end="5962">sigmoid function</strong> to predict probabilities.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5989" data-end="6039" class="">
<p data-start="5992" data-end="6039" class="">The <strong data-start="5996" data-end="6013">cost function</strong> is based on <strong data-start="6026" data-end="6038">log loss</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6040" data-end="6089" class="">
<p data-start="6043" data-end="6089" class="">It uses <strong data-start="6051" data-end="6071">gradient descent</strong> for optimization.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6090" data-end="6147" class="">
<p data-start="6093" data-end="6147" class=""><strong data-start="6093" data-end="6111">Regularization</strong> (L1, L2) helps prevent overfitting.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6148" data-end="6246" class="">
<p data-start="6151" data-end="6246" class="">Works best for <strong data-start="6166" data-end="6188">linearly separable</strong> problems but struggles with <strong data-start="6217" data-end="6245">non-linear relationships</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>

dark:prose-invert dark"><h1 data-start="0" data-end="57" class=""><strong data-start="2" data-end="55">Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE) - A Deep Dive</strong></h1>
<p data-start="59" data-end="350" class="">Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE) is a fundamental statistical method used to estimate the parameters of a probability distribution by maximizing the likelihood function. It is widely used in <strong data-start="253" data-end="273">machine learning</strong>, <strong data-start="275" data-end="298">logistic regression</strong>, <strong data-start="300" data-end="319">Gaussian models</strong>, and <strong data-start="325" data-end="349">hidden Markov models</strong>.</p>
<hr data-start="352" data-end="355" class="">
<h2 data-start="357" data-end="411" class=""><strong data-start="360" data-end="411">1. What is Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE)?</strong></h2>
<p data-start="412" data-end="574" class="">MLE finds the <strong data-start="426" data-end="445">best parameters</strong> (<span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span>) for a given dataset by maximizing the probability of observing the given data under a specific probabilistic model.</p>
<h3 data-start="576" data-end="593" class=""><strong data-start="580" data-end="593">Key Idea:</strong></h3>
<p data-start="594" data-end="784" class="">Given a dataset <strong data-start="610" data-end="646"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>X</mi><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo separator="true">,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo separator="true">,</mo><mo>…</mo><mo separator="true">,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">X = \{x_1, x_2, \dots, x_n\}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07847em;">X</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; <p data-start="836" data-end="873" class="">where the <strong data-start="846" data-end="869">likelihood function</strong> is:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>X</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>X</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><munderover><mo>∏</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>n</mi></munderover><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">L(\theta | X) = P(X | \theta) = \prod_{i=1}^{n} P(x_i | \theta)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; <ul data-start="946" data-end="1086">
<li data-start="946" data-end="1025" class="">
<p data-start="948" data-end="1025" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>X</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">L(\theta | X)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">L</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mord">∣</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07847em;">X</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span> measures how likely the data is given parameter <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1026" data-end="1086" class="">
<p data-start="1028" data-end="1086" class="">MLE selects the <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\theta</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span></span></span></span> that maximizes this likelihood.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1088" data-end="1091" class="">
<h2 data-start="1093" data-end="1140" class=""><strong data-start="1096" data-end="1140">2. Understanding the Likelihood Function</strong></h2>
<p data-start="1141" data-end="1219" class="">The likelihood function is the joint probability of observing all data points:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo separator="true">,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">L(\theta) = P(x_1, x_2, ..., x_n | \theta)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">L</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">θ</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; <p data-start="1271" data-end="1344" class="">For <strong data-start="1275" data-end="1327">independent and identically distributed (i.i.d.)</strong> data, we assume:</p>

<p data-start="1397" data-end="1501" class="">This means that we multiply the probability of each individual observation under the given distribution.</p>

<h2 data-start="1880" data-end="1924" class=""><strong data-start="1883" data-end="1924">3. Log-Likelihood Function (Why Log?)</strong></h2>
<p data-start="1925" data-end="2040" class="">Since likelihood functions involve products of small probabilities, <strong data-start="1993" data-end="2006">logarithm</strong> is used to simplify calculations:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>L</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>n</mi></munderover><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\log L(\theta) = \sum_{i=1}^{n} \log P(x_i | \theta)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; <hr data-start="2406" data-end="2409" class="">
<h2 data-start="2411" data-end="2478" class=""><strong data-start="2414" data-end="2478">4. Maximum Likelihood Estimation for Different Distributions</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="2479" data-end="2541" class=""><strong data-start="2483" data-end="2541">(a) MLE for Bernoulli Distribution (Coin Flip Example)</strong></h3>
<p data-start="2542" data-end="2622" class="">A Bernoulli distribution models a binary outcome (success/failure, heads/tails):</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>p</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>p</mi><mi>x</mi></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>p</mi><msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(x | p) = p^x (1 - p)^{(1-x)}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mord">∣</span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.7144em;"><span style="top: -3.113em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">x</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.188em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="mclose"><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.938em;"><span style="top: -3.113em; <p data-start="2662" data-end="2706" class="">where <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">p</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.625em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span></span></span></span> is the probability of success.</p>
<p data-start="2708" data-end="2759" class="">For <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span> coin flips, the likelihood function is:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>p</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><munderover><mo>∏</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>n</mi></munderover><msup><mi>p</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>p</mi><msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">L(p) = \prod_{i=1}^{n} p^{x_i} (1 - p)^{(1 - x_i)}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; <p data-start="2819" data-end="2849" class="">Taking the <strong data-start="2830" data-end="2848">log-likelihood</strong>:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>L</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>p</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>n</mi></munderover><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>+</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>p</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\log L(p) = \sum_{i=1}^{n} x_i \log p + (1 - x_i) \log (1 - p)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; <hr data-start="3657" data-end="3660" class="">
<h2 data-start="3662" data-end="3716" class=""><strong data-start="3665" data-end="3716">5. MLE in Machine Learning: Logistic Regression</strong></h2>
<p data-start="3717" data-end="3809" class="">MLE is the foundation of <strong data-start="3742" data-end="3765">logistic regression</strong>, where we model the probability of class 1:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>x</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><msup><mi>θ</mi><mi>T</mi></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(y=1 | x; <p data-start="4043" data-end="4132" class="">This is the same as <strong data-start="4063" data-end="4085">cross-entropy loss</strong>, which we optimize using <strong data-start="4111" data-end="4131">gradient descent</strong>.</p>
<hr data-start="4134" data-end="4137" class="">
<h2 data-start="4139" data-end="4184" class=""><strong data-start="4142" data-end="4184">6. Advantages and Disadvantages of MLE</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="4185" data-end="4205" class="">✅ <strong data-start="4191" data-end="4205">Advantages</strong></h3>
<p data-start="4206" data-end="4429" class="">✔ <strong data-start="4208" data-end="4233">Statistically optimal</strong> – Under large samples, MLE is unbiased and efficient.<br data-start="4287" data-end="4290">
✔ <strong data-start="4292" data-end="4335">Works with any probability distribution</strong> – Flexible across models.<br data-start="4361" data-end="4364">
✔ <strong data-start="4366" data-end="4399">Provides confidence intervals</strong> – Based on likelihood ratios.</p>
<h3 data-start="4431" data-end="4454" class="">❌ <strong data-start="4437" data-end="4454">Disadvantages</strong></h3>
<p data-start="4455" data-end="4672" class="">❌ <strong data-start="4457" data-end="4486">Computationally expensive</strong> – Involves solving complex optimization problems.<br data-start="4536" data-end="4539">
❌ <strong data-start="4541" data-end="4556">Overfitting</strong> – If the dataset is small, MLE may overfit.<br data-start="4600" data-end="4603">
❌ <strong data-start="4605" data-end="4636">Assumes independent samples</strong> – Doesn't handle dependencies well.</p>

<li data-start="5553" data-end="5656" class="">
<p data-start="5556" data-end="5656" class="">It is used in <strong data-start="5570" data-end="5655">logistic regression, Gaussian distributions, coin flips, and deep learning models</strong>.</p>

<p data-start="85" data-end="372" class="">A <strong data-start="87" data-end="104">Decision Tree</strong> is a popular <strong data-start="118" data-end="151">supervised learning algorithm</strong> used for both classification and regression tasks. It is a tree-like structure where internal nodes represent decisions based on features, branches represent possible outcomes, and leaf nodes represent final predictions.</p>
<hr data-start="374" data-end="377" class="">
<h2 data-start="379" data-end="413" class=""><strong data-start="382" data-end="413">1. What is a Decision Tree?</strong></h2>
<p data-start="414" data-end="677" class="">A Decision Tree is a flowchart-like model where:<br data-start="462" data-end="465">
✅ <strong data-start="467" data-end="485">Internal nodes</strong> represent feature tests (e.g., "Is age &gt; 30?").<br data-start="533" data-end="536">
✅ <strong data-start="538" data-end="550">Branches</strong> represent decision outcomes (e.g., Yes or No).<br data-start="597" data-end="600">
✅ <strong data-start="602" data-end="616">Leaf nodes</strong> represent final class labels (e.g., "Spam" or "Not Spam").</p>
<h3 data-start="679" data-end="733" class=""><strong data-start="683" data-end="731">Example of a Decision Tree for Loan Approval</strong></h3>

<p data-start="972" data-end="1048" class="">Each node makes a decision based on conditions, leading to a classification.</p>
<hr data-start="1050" data-end="1053" class="">
<h2 data-start="1055" data-end="1095" class=""><strong data-start="1058" data-end="1095">2. How Does a Decision Tree Work?</strong></h2>
<p data-start="1096" data-end="1241" class="">The key idea is to <strong data-start="1115" data-end="1149">split the dataset at each node</strong> based on a feature that <strong data-start="1174" data-end="1201">best separates the data</strong>. To determine the best feature, we use:</p>
<p data-start="1243" data-end="1324" class="">1️⃣ <strong data-start="1247" data-end="1258">Entropy</strong> (for Information Gain)<br data-start="1281" data-end="1284">
2️⃣ <strong data-start="1288" data-end="1302">Gini Index</strong> (for Gini Impurity)</p>
<p data-start="1326" data-end="1396" class="">These criteria help to determine <strong data-start="1359" data-end="1395">how "pure" or "impure" a node is</strong>.</p>
<hr data-start="1398" data-end="1401" class="">
<h2 data-start="1403" data-end="1444" class=""><strong data-start="1406" data-end="1444">3. Entropy – Measuring Uncertainty</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="1445" data-end="1464" class=""><strong data-start="1449" data-end="1464">Definition:</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1465" data-end="1551" class="">Entropy quantifies the amount of uncertainty in a dataset. The formula for entropy is:</p>

<p data-start="1599" data-end="1607" class="">where:</p>
<ul data-start="1608" data-end="1700">
<li data-start="1608" data-end="1658" class="">
<p data-start="1610" data-end="1658" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P_i</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.1389em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> is the probability of class <span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">i</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6595em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">i</span></span></span></span>,</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1659" data-end="1700" class="">
<p data-start="1661" data-end="1700" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">c</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">c</span></span></span></span> is the total number of classes.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="1702" data-end="1736" class=""><strong data-start="1706" data-end="1736">Interpretation of Entropy:</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="1737" data-end="1930">
<li data-start="1737" data-end="1828" class="">
<p data-start="1739" data-end="1828" class=""><strong data-start="1739" data-end="1764">Low Entropy (Near 0):</strong> The node is "pure," meaning most samples belong to one class.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1829" data-end="1930" class="">
<p data-start="1831" data-end="1930" class=""><strong data-start="1831" data-end="1857">High Entropy (Near 1):</strong> The node is "impure," meaning samples are equally divided among classes.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="1932" data-end="1970" class=""><strong data-start="1936" data-end="1970">Example Calculation of Entropy</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1971" data-end="2052" class="">Consider a dataset where we classify emails as <strong data-start="2018" data-end="2030">Spam (S)</strong> or <strong data-start="2034" data-end="2051">Not Spam (NS)</strong>:</p>
<div class="overflow-x-auto contain-inline-size"><table data-start="2054" data-end="2132" node="[object Object]"><thead data-start="2054" data-end="2072"><tr data-start="2054" data-end="2072"><th data-start="2054" data-end="2063">Label</th><th data-start="2063" data-end="2072">Count</th></tr></thead><tbody data-start="2092" data-end="2132"><tr data-start="2092" data-end="2110"><td>Spam (S)</td><td>3</td></tr><tr data-start="2111" data-end="2132"><td>Not Spam (NS)</td><td>7</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p data-start="2134" data-end="2204" class="">Total samples = 10<br data-start="2152" data-end="2155">
<span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>S</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0.3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P(S) = 3/10 = 0.3</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; <span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>H</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>X</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.3</mn><msub><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>0.3</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.7</mn><msub><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>0.7</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H(X) = - (0.3 \log_2 0.3 + 0.7 \log_2 0.7)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; <h2 data-start="2396" data-end="2448" class=""><strong data-start="2399" data-end="2448">4. Information Gain – Choosing the Best Split</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="2449" data-end="2468" class=""><strong data-start="2453" data-end="2468">Definition:</strong></h3>
<p data-start="2469" data-end="2554" class="">Information Gain (IG) measures the reduction in entropy after splitting on a feature.</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>G</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>H</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>P</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>k</mi></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><msub><mi>D</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi><mi>D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">∣</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>H</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">IG = H(Parent) - \sum_{i=1}^{k} \frac{|D_i|}{|D|} H(D_i)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.07847em;">I</span><span class="mord mathnormal">G</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mord mathnormal">a</span><span class="mord mathnormal">re</span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span><span class="mord mathnormal">t</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 3.1138em; vertical-align: -1.2777em;"></span><span class="mop op-limits"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.8361em;"><span style="top: -1.8723em; margin-left: 0em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span><span class="mrel mtight">=</span><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span><span class="mop op-symbol large-op">∑</span></span></span><span style="top: -4.3em; margin-left: 0em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.03148em;">k</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.2777em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.427em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">∣</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">D</span><span class="mord">∣</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">∣</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">D</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0278em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span>
<p data-start="2620" data-end="2628" class="">where:</p>
<ul data-start="2629" data-end="2803">
<li data-start="2629" data-end="2678" class="">
<p data-start="2631" data-end="2678" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>H</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>P</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H(Parent)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="mord mathnormal">a</span><span class="mord mathnormal">re</span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span><span class="mord mathnormal">t</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span> = Entropy of the parent node.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2679" data-end="2741" class="">
<p data-start="2681" data-end="2741" class=""><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>H</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H(D_i)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">D</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3117em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0278em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span> = Entropy of each child node after splitting.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2742" data-end="2803" class="">

<h3 data-start="2805" data-end="2852" class=""><strong data-start="2809" data-end="2852">Example Calculation of Information Gain</strong></h3>
<p data-start="2853" data-end="2927" class="">Let's say we split our email dataset based on <strong data-start="2899" data-end="2926">"Has Promotional Words"</strong>.</p>
<div class="overflow-x-auto contain-inline-size"><table data-start="2929" data-end="3147" node="[object Object]"><thead data-start="2929" data-end="2984"><tr data-start="2929" data-end="2984"><th data-start="2929" data-end="2948">Has Promo Words?</th><th data-start="2948" data-end="2959">Spam (S)</th><th data-start="2959" data-end="2975">Not Spam (NS)</th><th data-start="2975" data-end="2984">Total</th></tr></thead><tbody data-start="3040" data-end="3147"><tr data-start="3040" data-end="3093"><td>Yes</td><td>3</td><td>2</td><td>5</td></tr><tr data-start="3094" data-end="3147"><td>No</td><td>0</td><td>5</td><td>5</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p data-start="3149" data-end="3198" class=""><strong data-start="3149" data-end="3160">Step 1:</strong> Calculate entropy of each child node:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>H</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>Y</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>5</mn><msub><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>5</mn><msub><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>5</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0.971</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H(Yes) = - (3/5 \log_2 3/5 + 2/5 \log_2 2/5) = 0.971</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.22222em;">Y</span><span class="mord mathnormal">es</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">−</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord">3/5</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mop"><span class="mop">lo<span style="margin-right: 0.01389em;">g</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.207em;"><span style="top: -2.4559em; <span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>H</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>N</mi><mi>o</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>5</mn><msub><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>0</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>5</mn><msub><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>5</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mn>5</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">H(No) = - (0/5 \log_2 0 + 5/5 \log_2 5/5) = 0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; <p data-start="3313" data-end="3350" class=""><strong data-start="3313" data-end="3324">Step 2:</strong> Compute Information Gain:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>G</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>H</mi><mo <h2 data-start="3597" data-end="3645" class=""><strong data-start="3600" data-end="3645">5. Gini Index – An Alternative to Entropy</strong></h2>
<h3 data-start="3646" data-end="3665" class=""><strong data-start="3650" data-end="3665">Definition:</strong></h3>
<p data-start="3666" data-end="3754" class="">Gini Index (or Gini Impurity) measures how <strong data-start="3709" data-end="3719">impure</strong> a dataset is. It is calculated as:</p>
<span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>G</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>i</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mi>c</mi></munderover><msubsup><mi>P</mi><mi>i</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">Gini = 1 - \sum_{i=1}^{c} P_i^2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">G</span><span class="mord mathnormal">ini</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.9291em; vertical-align: -1.2777em;"></span><span class="mop op-limits"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.6514em;"><span style="top: -1.8723em; margin-left: 0em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">i</span><span class="mrel mtight">=</span><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span><span class="mop op-symbol large-op">∑</span></span></span><span style="top: -4.3em; margin-left: 0em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.05em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">c</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.2777em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">P</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8641em;"><span style="top: -2.453em;
